text: Is it possible to add custom styles into the rich text styles editor?
<@U2H3TT8F2|ajlaporte> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/ajlaporte/F58PJ1J0L/pasted_image_at_2017_05_04_09_54_am.png|Pasted image at 2017-05-04, 9:54 AM>
I thought I saw an article somewhere on it but I can seem to find it now
Good question <@U2H3TT8F2> :slightly_smiling_face: I’m very interested in
Also, is there a caching time set on files/image when you overwrite/update them
Are you suggesting adding custom styles into the WYSIWYG ?
Yep.
That’d be fun, but I doubt it - I’ve never heard of anyone trying it, but it’s a fine idea
I’d probably just say you should have a custom module that people can drop into flexible columns (that contains the custom styling options you want to apply to things)
So it’d be a rich text in the module, but you’d have the additional menu options in the custom module
Do you mean the additional options would be listed in the "Edit Modules" side panel correct?

I know CMS's like EpiServer and Ektron offer the ability to add custom styles to their editors. i think the main issue comes in that even though content is responsive by default, some customers who use tables (cringe) aren't able to have them be responsive by default without some JS trickery or having them go into the </> editor and add a class

it looks like HS is using TinyMCE for the rich text editor so I assume you can use something similar to TinyMCE's Custom Formats Example in the Edit Head section of the Template but I can't seem to get it working. I will keep looking at it <https://www.tinymce.com/docs/demo/format-custom/>
is there anyway to append the site title to the pages title without having to do HubL or JS?
in the content settings maybe? Title of the site?
(why not hubl)
I just dont want to have to go back through all the templates and do it, its that i cant do it via hubl
If thats the only option I'm cool with that
My question comes in though, when being looked at by google and other search engines, will they see the title as "Website Page | Company Name" or just "Website Page" that way

<@U2H3TT8F2|ajlaporte> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/ajlaporte/F58QSJUV8/pasted_image_at_2017_05_04_11_57_am.png|Pasted image at 2017-05-04, 11:57 AM> and commented: Essentially just trying to remove the client from having to type it in manually here in the settings tab

Thought on your issue <@U2H3TT8F2> - What if you include some jQuery in the template files that directly targets the WYSIWYG (to add additional functionality) - I mean… god what a terrible solution when you should be able to code it into the template… but still, if you ABSOLUTELY needed it you could get it
Thats the only thing I wish we could have control over on the templates when editing them is the ability to modify things like the `<title>` and other meta's that are in there by default

i mean if i had a custom coded template I could, but that would be crazy from a client side ease of use as if they ever wanted to add anything, they would need to know HubL to do it instead of just dragging modules around
I think for the time, I am just going to add in the documentation and provide what they should do in the title field.
